results.title: Incommunicado
results.brief_description: An example of student film production: to the accompaniment of Elizabeth Honey singing, an Edwardian period piece is unravelled in shots of costumes, bric-a-brac and objects d’arts of the time.

results.title: Incendio (D)
results.creator_credit: Craig Johnson, Eliot Tarlin and National Fire Protection Association (U.S.)
results.brief_description: This film is based on information gathered for a joint investigation of the Joelma Building fire in Sao Paulo, Brazil in 1974 by the National Fire Protection Association and the National Bureau of Standards (US Dept of Commerce). It is a sobering and haunting account of a real-life “towering inferno” - two hours of fire, 179 dead. It contains graphic and disturbing images of people leaping to their death. However, it also shows firefighting and rescue efforts and uses animation to show how fires spread in high rise buildings. Electronic score by Robert Ceely.

results.title: In touch
results.creator_credit: George Brandt, Veronica Sherborne and University of Bristol
results.brief_description: This film shows how following directions, student teachers in the first part of the film demonstrate dance movement geared to achieving certain results with mentally retarded children. During the second part the students work with individual children. Throughout, maxims of educational psychology are demonstrated.

results.title: In waters of the Persian Gulf
results.brief_description: A picture of life along the coasts of the Persian Gulf. Here life is a battle - a struggle for existence with the desert and with the sea. In the markets of the villages, the products of cottage industries are exchanged for the products of the sea or of the desert. But everywhere water is scarce. On the coast ships are built; ships for the trade of the gulf, for the fishermen and for the pearling industry.

results.title: In the Wake of the Stars
results.creator_credit: Mark McDonald, Walter Batty, Bede Whiteman and Cinesound
results.brief_description: Aviation came quickly in Australia. In the early days reliable DC3’s carried everyone and everything. Then new faster and more comfortable aircraft were sought: the Fokker Friendship from Holland, the super Viscount from France and turbo jets from America. During training flights the attractions of gracious Amsterdam, gay Paris, England’s spring, New York’s people, Rome’s buildings and Australia’s scenic attractions are presented.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark McDonald, Walter Batty, Bede Whiteman and Cinesound

results.title: In the wake of Mendana
results.creator_credit: Norman K Wallis and Western Pacific High Commission
results.brief_description: An impression of life in the British Solomon Islands. Shows the natural vegetation of the islands; native villages; schools; hospitals; churches; industries; activities of the natives - singing, dancing, canoe racing. Mentions the history of the islands and the administration.

results.title: In the USA
results.brief_description: Made to promote the attractions of the United States to the prospective visitor, this film shows airport and hotel registration procedures, the multi-lingual services available, and some of the popular tourist spots - New York, Washington and San Francisco.

results.title: In the swim
results.creator_credit: Frank Gardner and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: Young British swimmers and divers demonstrate their prowess. Champions seen in action include Margaret Edwards and Margaret Austen, Ian Black and Brian Phelps. Describes the important points of style and movement which they use in different types of swimming strokes and high dives.

results.title: In the South seas: palm and steeple
results.creator_credit: Gordon Babineau and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Interviews with foreign residents of the Solomon Islands provide a history of the involvement of plantation owners and Christian missions in the area. Contains very early footage of local customs. Narrated by George Woodcock.

results.title: Le Caillou
results.brief_description: A documentary about New Caledonia, which shows the nickel plant, and the inroads mining has made on the environment. Traditional forms of agriculture are shown, as well as the traditions of village life. These continue despite the French presence in the territory and the effects of nearly a century of resource exploitation on New Caledonia’s environment. Suitable for secondary school level.
